e4: Adopting the new policy would align the company with ethical standards of transparent and accurate financial reporting, fostering long-term investor trust and potentially avoiding legal issues. Although there may be initial confusion, clear communication about the change can mitigate misunderstanding and align all investors with the new, more ethical approach.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness to all investors. It should enable shareholders and stakeholders to make well-informed decisions based on true financial performance. Such a policy should avoid any practices that could mislead or disadvantage any investor group, particularly less sophisticated investors. Additionally, it should consider the potential impacts on market perception and legally comply with all regulatory standards to avoid misleading or unethical practices.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to ensure all investors, especially retail investors, are well-informed and understand the implications. Additionally, I would inquire about any measures planned to monitor the impact of this change on the company's stock performance and investor relations in the short and long term.
